Every odd integer is the difference of 2 squares
Proof:
1) Pick an odd number
░░ ░░ ░░ ░░ ░░

2) Bend it in half
░░ ░░ ░░
░░
░░

3) Fill in the rest
░░ ░░ ░░
░░ ▓▓ ▓▓
░░ ▓▓ ▓▓

The odd nbr is the area difference of the big and small squares

1093323105525817345.text: The Serendipity Visa resembles a Hayekian model of knowledge distribution. It is the free, creative flow of ideas that made California the financial behemoth that is today.

1093323104108113921.text:
The vetting process is based off a variety of criteria:

* Social capital
    * Influence level on Twitter & co
    * Provable skills, like writing or networking
* Financial capital
* Credentials

1093323100366745600.text: The Serendipity Visa is not for individuals who possess abnormally exceptional skills. In fact, it is for people who signal that they *may become little aliens one day*.

1093323098609405953.text: Think of it as “discounted human capital”: bring in a bunch of potential crème de la crème so that the odds for them to become the crème de la crème increase.

1093323097514614784.text: The Serendipity Visa is an immigration policy that endows carefully selected individuals with long-term stays in capital-abundant places.

1093323096482869248.text: Due to the reduced rate of worldwide innovation, the number of "right persons at the right place and time" moments is decreasing.

1038942550894235649.text: Research is fundamental, but UX is revealing. People involved in the calls excelled in tweaking the computer science problems and did superb work on that. A pot of interesting concepts was brought up: sparse Merkle trees, CAS and BLS sigs, recursive SNARKs, but...

1038942549447258112.text: Although Plasma now has this expansive definition, it is still a huge experiment which makes many trade-offs to achieve a few clearly defined goals. However, it's worth a shot, as it improves the status quo in a sufficient number of scenarios.

1038942547878535169.text: Plasma evolved from being a MapReduce computation design pattern to a rather inclusive framework, where scalable micropayments, decentralised exchanges, batch auctions and whatnot coexist. A few notable contenders: MVP, Cash and Debit. Learn more on https://learnplasma.org/

1038942546045501440.text: Plasma is NOT a product or a specific protocol, but a set of *primitives* which you can use to build your scalable project.

1038942543935954944.text: Knowledge of computer science, economics and occasionally spooky maths (looking at you SNARKs) is required if you wish to grasp the fundamentals of Plasma and its forum threads. For the first two subjects, head to http://cryptoeconomics.study , courtesy of @karl_dot_tech!
